arctic.description: Dramatic reductions in Arctic sea ice threaten ecosystems and fisheries, disrupt traditional lifestyles, and erode coastlines. Increasing development activities may boost the region’s economy, but they also increase risks to ecosystems and the environment. Explore landcover, current drought, and historical observations in this rapidly changing region.

group1.title: BIA Lands and Arctic Sea Ice
group1.description: Explore the environmental changes Alaska Native Villages have seen as the extent of September Arctic sea ice has decreased over time.

group2.title: Energy Infrastructure and Permafrost
group2.description: Explore where energy infrastructure sits atop permafrost that is increasingly susceptible to melting.

coastal.description: As sea level rises, so do instances of flooding along the coast. Rising waters increasingly threaten buildings and infrastructure through storm surge, strong waves, heavy precipitation, and high-tide "nuisance" flooding. Property owners and municipalities can check their vulnerability to coastal flooding from current flood hazards as well as future sea level rise.

group1.title: Development and Sea Level Rise
group1.description: Explore what development is threatened by sea level rise.

group3.title: Coastal Power and Storm-Surge
group3.description: Explore which coastal power plants may be vulnerable to storm-surge.

group4.title: Coastal Power and Sea Level Rise
group4.description: Explore which coastal power plants are threatened by sea level rise.

group5.title: Coastal Wetlands and Sea Level Rise
group5.description: Explore coastal wetlands and sea level rise.

group6.title: Pollution Sources and Sea Level Rise
group6.description: Explore where sources of pollution may contaminate ecosystems if affected by sea level rise.

group7.title: Transportation and Sea Level Rise
group7.description: Explore Transportation and sea level rise.

ecosystems.description: Ecosystems that serve as natural sources of food, timber, and clean water are increasingly threatened by changing conditions. View landcover, wetlands, and rivers & streams to visualize the location and extent of land-based ecosystems. Compare these locations to climate stressors such as sea level rise and drought.

group1.title: Coastal Wetlands and Sea Level Rise
group1.description: Explore how wetlands, natural areas, and open spaces along coasts are threatened by sea level rise.

group2.title: Pollution Sources and Sea Level Rise
group2.description: Explore where sources of pollution may contaminate ecosystems if affected by sea level rise.

energy.description: As temperatures warm, demand for energy is expected to increase. Exposed energy infrastructure—particularly along our coasts—may lead to disruptions in energy supply. Managers of energy assets can check current flood hazards as well as visualizations of flooding from future sea level rise.

group1.title: Power Plants and Sea Level Rise
group1.description: Explore where power plants are threatened by sea level rise.

group2.title: Power Plants and Storm-Surge
group2.description: Explore power plants that may be threated by storm-surge.

food.description: Increasing heat waves, drought, and very heavy precipitation have the potential to reduce agricultural productivity in future decades. Changes in crop yields and livestock production can increase food prices and reduce food security.

group1.title: Cropland and drought
group1.description: Explore which crops are currently threatened by drought.

group2.title: Chickens and Mean Daily Temperature
group2.description: Explore locations where farms raise chickens for meat. Consider how chickens in these locations will fare in future decades by viewing projections for maximum temperatures.

health.description: Increases in extreme weather events, poor air quality, and transmittable illnesses threaten human health. Explore areas where high percentages of residents are elderly and/or poor, and where other factors increase social vulnerability. People in these areas may require assistance during events such as heat waves, storms, or flooding.

group1.title: Poverty and Cooling Degree Days
group1.description: Explore how areas with relatively high percentages of people who live below the poverty line (many of whom lack access to air conditioning) intersect with projected increases in cooling degree days.

group2.title: Percent Elderly and Days Over 95
group2.description: Explore where areas with relatively high numbers of elderly residents coincide with days over 95°F.

marine.description: This is the main station desciption. Should include overview of all groups on the page. It goes on the main headline on the stations page

group1.title: Fishing and wind potential
group1.description: Explore how locations of economic value for fishing overlap areas with relatively high potential for offshore wind energy.

transportation.description: Extreme events increasingly threaten land-, water-, and air-based transportation systems and supply chains. View the location of transportation assets such as highways, bridges, and airports, and check to see where they coincide with flooding hazards and the risk of inundation from sea level rise.

group1.title: Transportation and Sea Level Rise
group1.description: Explore which elements of our transportation system are threatened by rising seas.

group2.title: Transportation and Storm-Surge
group2.description: Explore where projections show storm surge impacting transportation systems.

group3.title: Transportation and River Flooding
group3.description: Explore where projections show river flooding impacting transportation systems.

tribal_nations.description: Climate change increasingly impacts land, foods, and lifestyles of American Indians. Survey the extent of Indian land and explore landcover and social vulnerability in these locations. Check the land's vulnerability to climate stressors such as sea level rise, flood hazards, and drought.

group1.title: Tribal Nations and Sea Level Rise
group1.description: Explore BIA Indian lands in the Pacific Northwest that are threatened by sea level rise.

group2.title: Tribal Nations and Storm-Surge
group2.description: Explore which BIA Indian Lands have an increased risk from storm-surge.

group3.title: Tribal Nations and Max Temperatures
group3.description: Explore which BIA Indian Lands will see greatest mean daily temperature increases over the next 100 years.

group4.title: Tribal Nations and Min Temperatures
group4.description: Explore which BIA Indian Lands will see greatest mean daily min temperature increases over the next 100 years.

group5.title: Tribal Nations and River Flooding
group5.description: Explore which BIA Indian Lands will be at greatest risk for river flooding.

water.description: Changing conditions are increasing threats of both flooding and drought. Flood zone maps can help you identify areas that are at risk of flooding and the current drought layer shows which regions are abnormally dry or experiencing drought. View the land cover layer to get a sense of what may be impacted by flooding or drought.

group1.title: Population Density and River Flooding
group1.description: Explore where densely populated areas in the United States have an elevated risk for significant flooding in the next 5 days.

group2.title: Development and River Flooding
group2.description: Explore where development may be threatened by river flooding.

weather_stations.title: Weather Stations
weather_stations.description: Check how observed temperature and precipitation measurements compare to long-term averages at weather stations near your area of interest. Look for times when temperatures are above average and/or precipitation is below average for weeks at a time: these indicate times that drought conditions may develop.

bia_indian_lands.title: BIA Indian Lands
bia_indian_lands.description: This layer shows  American Indian Reservations, Federally Recognized Tribal Entities, and Alaska Native Villages in the contiguous U.S. and Alaska.

september_arctic_sea_ice.title: September Arctic Sea Ice
september_arctic_sea_ice.description: View how Arctic sea ice—shown in September of each year from 2000-2015 has changed over time. Reduced sea ice restricts the range of subsistence hunters, and exposes the coast to erosion.

energy_infrastructure.title: Energy Infrastructure
energy_infrastructure.description: Check the locations of power plants and oil and gas refineries. View the paths of pipelines that transport energy materials and transmission wires that distribute electricity.

permafrost.title: Permafrost
permafrost.description: Check where the ground is currently considered to be “permanently” frozen. Thawing permafrost can result in damage to infrastructure when the ground surface becomes uneven or unstable. Permafrost is categorized as continuous, discontinuous, sporadic, or isolated, based on its areal extent.

critical_coastal_facilities.title: Critical Coastal Facilities
critical_coastal_facilities.description: View locations of hospitals, schools, and fire and police stations along the Atlantic and Gulf Coasts. If flooded, these structures present an immediate threat to life, public health, and safety.

sea_level_rise.title: Sea Level Rise (For 1 to 6 Feet)
sea_level_rise.description: View areas that will be covered by seawater during high tides after the indicated amount of local sea level rise. A few inches of water will cover the lightest blue areas; water will be deeper where the map is dark blue. Bright green areas will be below sea level, but are not connected to the ocean. Visualize changes over time by turning on progressively higher sea levels.

development_density.title: Development Density
development_density.description: View the intensity of development across land based on the percentage of constructed versus natural materials at each location. Areas that are essentially covered by buildings are classified as high intensity development. Parks and other areas with less than 20 percent constructed materials are considered as open space.

shallow_coastal_flooding.title: Shallow Coastal Flooding
shallow_coastal_flooding.description: View coastal areas susceptible to flooding during high tide. These “nuisance” floods can occur during very high tides, or when distant winds push seawater onto land.

public_attractions.title: Public Attractions
public_attractions.description: View non-emergency structures catalogued in the National Map.

coastal_vulnerability_index.title: Coastal Vulnerability Index
coastal_vulnerability_index.description: Check which coastal areas are most susceptible to change as a result of sea level rise. Index values are based on physical parameters such as the shape of the coast, tidal range, and average wave heights.

hurricane_evacuation.title: Hurricane Evacuation Routes
hurricane_evacuation.description: View major roads designated as hurricane evacuation routes.

storm_surge.title: Storm Surge (Categories 1-5)
storm_surge.description: View potential inundation due to storm-surge flooding from landfalling hurricanes of categories 1-5.

coastal_power_plants.title: Coastal Power Plants
coastal_power_plants.description: View locations and types of power plants along the U.S. coast and Great Lakes.

coastal_wetlands.title: Coastal Wetlands
coastal_wetlands.description: View wetlands and other natural areas along the coast.

flood_hazard_zones.title: Flood Hazard Zones
flood_hazard_zones.description: Check which local areas have been designated by FEMA to be at risk of flooding. Aqua areas show land judged to have a 1% chance of flooding each year; this area is also known as the base flood zone or 100-year flood zone. Colors and patterns also indicate floodways and other hazard areas.

pollution_sources.title: Potential Pollution Sources
pollution_sources.description: View facilities, sites, or places subject to environmental regulation or of environmental interest such as Brownfield properties, hazardous waste sites, Superfund sites, and toxic chemicals.

critical_habitat.title: Critical Habitat
critical_habitat.description: View the location of habitat designated as critical in order to preserve the ecosystems where threatened and endangered species live.

tmax.title: Avg Daily Max Temp (°F)
tmax.description: Maximum temperatures are one indicator of conditions that can interfere with ecosystem functions. View how temperatures are projected to change during future decades.

tmin.title: Mean Daily Min Temperature
tmin.description: Minimum temperatures are one indicator of conditions that can interfere with ecosystem functions. View how temperatures are projected to change during future decades.

national_forests.title: National Forests
national_forests.description: View the location and extent of lands designated as National Forests.

days_tmin_lt_32f.title: Days below 32 degrees
days_tmin_lt_32f.description: View how the number of days per year with below-freezing temperatures decreases over time.

power_plants.title: Power Plants
power_plants.description: View the locations and types of power plants.

hdd_65f.title: Heating Degree Days
hdd_65f.description: View how demand for energy to heat homes and businesses during cool seasons decreases in future decades.

cropland.title: Cropland
cropland.description: View the types of crops in place during the previous main growing season.

drought.title: Current Drought
drought.description: Examine where the amount of water available in soils, streams, and lakes is lower than usual for this time of year. In this weekly map, the darker the color, the more severe the lack of moisture. Depending on how severe it is and how long it lasts, drought can devastate crops and forests, lead to food shortages for livestock and wildlife, increase risks for wildfires, and have a negative effect on local and regional economies.

chickens.title: Chickens per 100 Acres Farmland
chickens.description: Explore areas where relatively large numbers of chickens are raised for meat.

mooring.title: Mooring Facilities
mooring.description: View locations along inland rivers where barges can anchor to take on goods such as grains from elevators.

hospitals.title: Hospitals
hospitals.description: View the location of hospitals: explore which are vulnerable to sea level rise or other flood hazards

severe_weather.title: Severe Weather
severe_weather.description: Explore locations that have the potential for heavy precipitation, flooding, or severe weather over the next 3-7 days.

percent_poverty.title: Percent Poverty
percent_poverty.description: Colors show the ercent of population below the poverty threshold in 2000. The darker the color, the higher the percentage of people in poverty. Communities with high percentages of poor residents may need support in preparing for hazards, or recovering from disaster.

cdd_65f.title: Cooling Degree Days
cdd_65f.description: View how demand for energy to cool homes and businesses during the warm season increases in the future. Consider how people who don’t have access to air conditioning will fare.

percent_elderly.title: Percent Elderly
percent_elderly.description: View the percent of population aged 65-79 in 2000. The darker the color, the higher the percentage of elderly people in the population. Communities with elevated social vulnerability (as measured by the U.S. Census) may need support in preparing for hazards, or recovering from disaster.

days_tmax_gt_95f.title: Days Above 95 Degrees F
days_tmax_gt_95f.description: View how the number of days per year with temperatures over 95°F increases during future decades.

atlantic_fishing.title: Atlantic Fishing Revenue Intensity
atlantic_fishing.description: View the mean annual economic revenue from all fishing activities for areas in the Atlantic Ocean (measured from 2007 to 2012).

offshore_wind.title: Offshore Wind Potential
offshore_wind.description: View average annual wind speed off the coast of the United States.

development.title: Areas Converted to Development
development.description: View areas converted to development between 1996 and 2011.

transportation_system.title: Transportation System
transportation_system.description: View the locations of elements of the transportation system.

watersheds.title: Watersheds
watersheds.description: View watershed boundaries and the streams and rivers that drain them.

river_flooding.title: Outlook for Significant River Flooding
river_flooding.description: Check the general outlook for significant river flooding. Note that this layer does not depict all areas of minor flooding or small-scale events such as localized flooding and/or flash flooding.

population_density.title: Populaton Density
population_density.description: Find centers of population across the Arctic in this global map layer.

wildland_urban.title: Wildland/Urban Interface
wildland_urban.description: View areas where housing extends through forested land, resulting in increased risk of fire for both. The maps shows area of land where a minimum spatial density of housing intersects with a map of wildfire hazards.
